sub_title: Associate Professor at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
summary:
Passionate scientist, mentor and teacher operating at the interfaces of organic chemistry with (chemical) biology. Interested in anything that organic chemistry can contribute to the bigger questions about medicines and health. Equally interested in joining academic students in their journeys through science, amongst others by innovations integrating science and teaching.

I studied organic chemistry at Radboud University Nijmegen, where I graduated in August 1998. I subsequently worked at DSM Research as a temporary researcher on biocatalysis and organic oxidants until June 1999. Thereafter I moved to Vanderbilt University in Nashville, USA where I started my PhD work on organic ligands for nanocrystals and on the development of novel antioxidants.

After completion of my PhD work in 2003, I returned to the Netherlands where I joined the Division of Medicinal Chemistry as a postdoctoral fellow. During the next few years, I participated in various projects involving e.g. the development of histamine- and chemokine-receptor ligands as well as the study of derivatization reagents for ESI-MS techniques. In 2009 and 2023, I was appointed assistant and associate professor of Synthetic Medicinal Chemistry. My current research interests involve the design and synthesis of compounds that are of interest in biological contexts. 
Here are some presentations highlighting key current research interests:
- Fragment-based drug discovery and the potential to use biomass, 2022: tinyurl.com/2eb8pb2w
- Photopharmacology as applied to G protein-coupled receptor proteins
  (English, 2019: https://tinyurl.com/35dyu7px / Dutch, 2023: tinyurl.com/3878bbdr).

I also have an interest in educational innovation, preferably in a combination with chemistry. The focus in these efforts is on the use of IT tools to stimulate active learning and I have been exploring several of such approaches since 2010, supported by educational innovation grants from VU Amsterdam. In 2013, I received the Dutch national KNCV chemistry teaching award (awarded every three years to a teacher from Dutch academia). The innovation entitled 'Publish and Flourish', which I co-wrote with Danny Scholten, received the 2019 KnowVU Audience Award.
Here is a workshop I gave in February 2020 on some of my educational innovations (application of Blended Learning and Flipped Classroom): tinyurl.com/56pffszz

Other lifelong passions have been (and still are) inline skating, bicycling, metro systems, tattoos and life outside The Netherlands.

awards.title: 2019 KnowVU Audience Award (co-applicant Danny Scholten): Publish and Flourish
awards.description: Peer feedback, in which students evaluate each other’s work, is a valued instrument in education. In this proposal, we will take peer feedback a significant step further by incorporating into a master course all steps of an actual publication process for a scientific article, ranging from guideline checks all the way to new experiments required by an editor to further support claims. In doing so, we aim to stimulate the development of critical thinking skills that are not only vital for conducting successful scientific inquiry, but also contribute to academic success and boost the employability of students inside and outside academia.

awards.title: 2018 VU Grassroots IT in Education Award (co-applicant / main applicant Dr. Oscar van Linden): De tweedejaars BSc student als junior onderzoeker: LabBuddy pilotstudie in een 2e-jaars organisch-chemisch practicum
awards.description: Incorporation of software-based experimental design in a 2nd-year synthesis practical course. The main applicant is Dr. Oscar van Linden. As the coordinating teacher of the practical course, I support the initiative and streamline chemistry planning. In collaboration with Oscar van Linden and Elsa Boswijk.

awards.title: 2017 FEW Teaching Innovation Award: readily accessible technology for Virtual Reality in (bio)molecular education
awards.description: We developed technology to inspect (bio)molecular structures in virtual reality using inexpensive Google Cardboards and the smartphones of students. In collaboration with Albert Kooistra and Jacqueline van Muijlwijk.

awards.title: 2015 VU Grassroots IT in Education Award: the use of Clipquest as learning analytics tool for blended learning.
awards.description: We developed technology to insert Multiple Choice questions in stand-alone slidecasts, gather the back-end answers and inspect these for trends. In collaboration with Danny Scholten, Erik Boon and Wessel Joren.

awards.title: 2014 VU Grassroots IT in Education Award: merging Presentain and MyMediasite software: a broadly applicable platform for recording editable weblectures during classes
awards.description: We developed technology to record a class simply using the smartphone of the teacher and edit the resulting slidecasts for stand-alone use in active learning methods (Blended Learning, Flipped Classroom). In collaboration with Danny Scholten, Erik Boon, Neek Kurat and Timothy Kozak.

awards.title: 2013-2016: National Academic Chemistry Teacher

awards.title: 2010 VU Grassroots IT in Education Award: the use of 3D beaming technology in a master course Organic Chemistry
awards.description: Organic chemistry principles were illustrated in the classroom using a contemporary 3D beamer. In collaboration with Jacqueline van Muijlwijk and Mark Verheij.
